attributes.action: Allow all babies born no matter the stage of pregnancy a Birth Certificate.
attributes.additional_details:
During a routine scan just shy of twenty weeks pregnant I found out my son Henry had passed away at 15 weeks. Two days later I went on to be induced and gave birth to him. Did I receive a birth certificate for him? No, but why?

The definition of a birth certificate is- an official document issued to record a person's birth and identify them by name, place, date of birth, and parentage. 

No where does it state the child has to be viable for life.

#HenrysLegacy
attributes.background: I believe all babies born no matter the gestation of loss deserve to be recognised. They lived inside the womb of their mother and were then born into the world. If a woman gives birth to a child, that child deserves a birth certificate, to be recognised as part of this world.
